intro: Alsine rostrata var. granatensis, commonly known as the granate alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Native to regions of southern Europe, it thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its delicate appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native ecosystems.
